**User:**
Hey, I saw something about a bug bounty program for the PBaaS protocol and I'm curious about what's being offered. Can you tell me more about that? And what's the deal with the 🎃Chain?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus Coin Foundation is running a bug bounty program to encourage users to test the PBaaS protocol on the testnet and report any bugs or security issues they find. The program is designed to incentivize users to help identify and fix any potential problems before the mainnet release.

For the first 10 people who report an actual protocol bug, the Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC. If someone finds and reports an exploitable security hole in the protocol, the bounty will be a minimum of 1,000 VRSC. For serious potential security issues, the bounty can be as high as 10,000 VRSC.

Now, about the 🎃Chain: it's a new, merge mineable PBaaS chain that has been created to showcase the capabilities of VerusIDs and currency emoji support. The chain is a testbed for users to try out the PBaaS protocol and report any bugs or issues they find. The tongue-in-cheek warning about merge mining the 🎃Chain at midnight is a lighthearted way to encourage users to participate in the bug bounty program and test the protocol thoroughly.

Overall, the bug bounty program and the 🎃Chain are part of Verus' efforts to ensure the stability and security of its PBaaS protocol before mainnet release. By encouraging users to test the protocol and report any bugs, Verus can identify and fix potential issues, resulting in a more robust and reliable platform for users.

## Verus PBaaS and DeFi RC5 - BUG BOUNTIES
At this time, we are not aware of any bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross chain protocols on this version of testnet. We do not anticipate any changes to the PBaaS protocol before mainnet release, and we hope you will join us on testnet trying out all of the incredible capabilities and looking for any potential, remaining issues that can possibly be found before mainnet release. While we don’t expect it to be easy to find bugs in the protocol, The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC (possibly more for security related reports) for the first 10 people who are first to report any actual protocol bug before mainnet release, meaning failure of a properly executed command or API on a functioning VRSCTEST or PBaaS chain to function as intended. If anyone is first to find and describe the exploit for an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty will be a minimum of 1,000 VRSC, and for a serious potential security issue, 10,000 $VRSC.## Emoji IDs and 🎃Chain
In the spirit of this release day, we have taken advantage of VerusIDs and currency emoji support and created a new, merge mineable PBaaS chain, 🎃. It has been said that those who merge mine 🎃chain at midnight will disappear into the crypto-metaverse, never to be seen again, become VerusID avatars, and be forever doomed to being bought and sold on the VRSCTEST marketplace for all eternity (or until the next testnet reset). YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!
